item.title: Donutal Is a Papers Please-Style "Alien Screening" Game from Arc System Works
item.content:encoded:
Arc System Works, the studio responsible for classic fighting games like Guilty Gear and BlazBlue, has announced Donutal, an "alien screening adventure" in which you'll be deciding whether to grant aliens entry to Earth.

The game, which bears more than a few similarities to indie hits like Papers, Please and No, I'm Not a Human (and the aliens very definitely are not in this case), will be coming to PC via Steam sometime this year, although no release date has been given yet.

Arc System Works describes Donutal as a game in which you "uncover true identities through conversation", which is also the main mechanic of the game; you'll be talking to aliens, trying to figure out their motives, and then accepting or rejecting their applications to enter the planet.

You'll play as someone who's just been awakened from 150 years of cryosleep, and you'll have to commit yourself to your new role of Alien Entry Examiner despite the fact that you're suffering from amnesia.

While examining aliens' applications, you can summon them to an interrogation room, and by summoning different combinations of aliens, you may learn more about their motivations for coming to Earth.

Additionally, you'll have to figure out whether prosperous aliens who can contribute to the planet via tourism or academia could also be dangerous individuals; getting this wrong could lead to "irreversible consequences", according to Arc.

Each day, you'll be greeted with a morning news bulletin that will reflect how well you did in screening aliens and allowing the right ones to join the Earth population. You can check out a trailer for Donutal here.

Donutal is coming to PC via Steam sometime this year. A demo for the game is available now if you'd like to see whether it's your cup of tea or not. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Bloodlines 2's The Chinese Room Teams Up With Lyrical Games for Next Project
item.content:encoded:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 developer The Chinese Room has revealed that it's partnered up with Valor Mortis publisher Lyrical Games for its next project, so it looks like Bloodlines 2's failure hasn't dissuaded the studio.

In a news post on its official website, The Chinese Room says the "upcoming, unannounced" project will be published by Lyrical Games, but that the British developer will retain "creative autonomy and IP ownership".

Lyrical Games' duties will include "full financing, strategic production support, and collaborative go-to-market planning", which sounds about right for a publisher. The Chinese Room says the partnership with the publisher builds on Lyrical's "commitment to backing distinctive, high-craft projects".

The Chinese Room CEO Ed Daly says the partnership will give the studio the "confidence and support to push creatively" in order to "stand out in today's market", while Lyrical head Blake Rochkind says the developer's next game has a "strong vision" and that his company is aiming to "remove friction" from development.

Assuming this project is next in The Chinese Room's pipeline, it'll be the studio's first game since last year's poorly-received Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2, which spent a long time in development hell before being "rescued" by the British developer.

Reflecting on Bloodlines 2's poor reception, former Chinese Room head Dan Pinchbeck suggested that the game shouldn't have been released under the Bloodlines name, which created expectations the studio was unable to meet.

Whether Pinchbeck is right or not, Bloodlines 2 was released as Bloodlines 2, and it resulted in a pretty dismal year for publisher Paradox thanks to its failure. It's probably safe to say that whatever The Chinese Room's next game is, it's not Bloodlines 3.

The Chinese Room might have been the outfit behind Bloodlines 2, but the studio is usually better-known for its contemplative narrative games (which some might refer to as "walking simulators") like Still Wakes the Deep and Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs.

We'll have to wait and see whether this project is more like those games than Bloodlines 2, but for now, it looks like The Chinese Room has secured a publisher, at least. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Free League's Latest Dragonbane Trudvang Kickstarter Slays Funding Goal in Minutes
item.content:encoded:
Free League's new Dragonbane Trudvang Kickstarter is a runaway success. The latest crowdfunding campaign brings the studio's fantasy RPG system back to its older, Nordic fantasy-themed setting. It has already reached its initial funding goal.

The Dragonbane Trudvang Kickstarter Campaign

According to the campaign page, Dragonbane Trudvang is a standalone tabletop RPG set within the Trudvang setting. The setting, which has been a part of the fantasy RPG for two decades, is set in a dark fantasy world inspired by Nordic and Celtic folklore. The books are fully compatible with the current edition of Dragonbane.

Dragonbane Trudvang will include four hardback books in both Swedish and English. The books will contain evocative artwork by artists Paul Bonner, Alvaro Tapia, Justin Gerard, Daniel Zrom, and many others. The books contents will contain new and adjusted rules of the Dragonbane system to fit the new setting.

One of the books will contain new player options. The Core Rulebook contains new playable kin such as Stormlander human, Borjornikka dwarves, and Korpikalli Elves, new professions and subspecialties, unique lifepaths for each kin and profession, new heroic abilities, and new magic unique to Trudvang.

The other books in the campaign provide GM Tools and worldbuilding. One book, aptly named The World of Trudvang, will provide info on the setting, including the history, geography, and faiths of the world, as well as rules for traveling the land. The third book is a Bestiary, including beasts like the Brotbeast and the Hrimtursir.

The fourth book of Dragonbane Trudvang is a prewritten campaign. The campaign, The Saga of the Black Star, is an epic, four-part adventure available for the first time in English.

The pledge tiers for Dragonbane Trudvang are as follows:

  • Digital Core Book for $22: A PDF of the Core Rulebook
  • Core Rulebook for $45: Physical and digital copy of the Core Rulebook
  • Digital Trudvang Bundle for $78: Digital copies of the Core Rulebook, World of Trudvang, Bestiary, and Saga of the Black Star books
  • Collector's Core Rulebook for $78: A Kickstarter-exclusive deluxe Collector's Edition of the Core Rulebook, and a digital copy
  • Trudvang Bundle for $168: Physical and digital copies of all four books
  • Stormlander Bundle for $199: Everything in the Trudvang Bundle, a GM Screen, and a set of Trudvang-themed dice and cards
  • Collector's Trudvang Bundle for $288: Kickstarter-exclusive Collector's Edition physical copies of all four books and digital copies
  • Collector's Stormlander Bundle for $321: Everything in the Collector's Trudvang Bundle, a GM Screen, and a set of dice and cards
  • Dimwalker Bundle for $498: Everything in the Collector's Stormlander Bundle, a cloth map of the Trudvang setting 

At the time of writing, the Dragonbane Trudvang Kickstarter has raised $808,962, completely overwhelming its initial funding goal of $27,667. This has unlocked several stretch goals for the campaign, including new optional add-ons, the addition of book ribbons, additional content, a soundtrack, a digital artbook, and solo mode rules.

The campaign concludes on March 19, 2026.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition Switch 2 Version Announced, and It's Out Now
item.content:encoded:
If you're a Switch 2 owner and you were hoping for a native upgrade for mecha RPG Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition, then hope no longer, because Nintendo has granted your wishes.

As revealed in a new trailer, Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition is now available on Switch 2. That's right; it's not coming to the console at some point in the future, but now, and whether you already own the game or not, you can grab it on Nintendo's new machine.

If you prefer to wait for a physical version, though, you'll have to wait a little bit longer, because Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition isn't coming to Switch 2 in physical form until April 16th.

As you might expect from a Switch 2 Edition release, Xenoblade Chronicles X will have enhanced resolution and increased frame rates on Switch 2; Nintendo promises "up to 4K" and "up to 60fps" from the Switch 2 version.

In case you need a reminder, Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition was released for Switch back in March last year. It is, as the name suggests, a re-release of the 2015 RPG, which was previously exclusive to the Wii U.

The new version doesn't just give Xenoblade Chronicles X a new coat of paint; it's also got new story content for you to enjoy, as well as improvements to the game's UI (and, yes, graphical improvements and tweaks).

If you want to get a sense for how Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition runs on Switch 2, you can check out the new trailer below.

Sadly, there hasn't been any word on other games in the Xenoblade series getting Switch 2 Editions, so if you were hoping for an upgraded version of the adventure that kicked off the franchise (sort of), you're out of luck, at least for now.

Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition is available right now for Switch 2 and Switch. The physical version launches on April 16th for Switch 2.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Paldean Wonders Set Brings Adorable New Cards Next Week
item.content:encoded:
The Pokemon Company has announced Paldean Wonders, the next major set for Pokemon TCG Pocket, and it's got some adorable Paldean Pokemon for you to discover, including the three mascot starters.

This new set follows on from January's Fantastical Parade expansion, and it's launching on February 25th across both Android and iOS. As you've probably guessed from the name, Paldean Wonders revolves mainly around Pokemon and related cards from the Paldea region.

New cards being introduced as part of this set include adorable depictions of starter Pokemon Fuecoco, Quaxly, and Sprigatito, as well as Paldean standouts like Maushold, Ceruledge, and Klawf, among others. It's an absolute Scarlet and Violet jamboree.

Special new cards include a Meowscarada ex card with some eye-popping artwork, as well as a very fun Gholdengo ex in which everyone's favorite Cheestring (search it up online if you don't have these near you) reaches out of the card to pelt you with coins.

Of course, it's not all about the 'mons; there will also be a host of new Supporter cards introduced in Paldean Wonders, including characters like Nemona and Arven, who play a pivotal role in Scarlet and Violet's (rather excellent) storyline.

Paldean Wonders is a themed booster pack rather than a full-blooded expansion; expect something along the lines of Secluded Springs or Eevee Grove rather than bigger prospects like Wisdom of Sea and Sky.

You can check out the new trailer for Pokemon TCG Pocket's Paldean Wonders expansion, which shows off some of the artwork you can expect to admire if you get cards from this set, right here.

Pokemon TCG Pocket's Paldean Wonders set launches on February 25th. The game is available to download and play for free right now on Android and iOS. Stay tuned for more on all things Pokemon TCG Pocket-related.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Destiny 2 Shadow and Order Update Delayed by Over Three Months
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Bungie has revealed that Destiny 2's Shadow and Order update will be delayed by quite a significant amount of time in order for the devs to implement "large revisions".

Speaking on Bluesky, Bungie says the update, which was originally due to arrive in just a couple of weeks, will now be launching across all platforms on June 9th instead. The delay is being put into place so that Bungie can "include sizable quality-of-life updates".

Not only has the update been delayed, but it'll also be renamed now as well, so when it does arrive, make sure you're not looking for patch notes for Shadow and Order, because they won't exist.

Previously-announced features like weapon tier upgrading will still be included in whatever Shadow and Order ends up being called, but Bungie is also adding new features like tier 5 stats for Exotic armor sets, expanding Tiered Gear to raids and dungeons, and more.

Destiny 2 isn't going to sleep between now and June, either; Bungie promises that the game will receive regular quality-of-life updates before then, as well as the Guardian Games event in March and "the return of a more frequent Iron Banner cadence" in April.

Don't expect too much more info about Shadow and Order anytime soon, though; Bungie says it'll reveal more about the update, as well as what's coming next for Destiny 2, "closer to launch", and doesn't provide a more specific date than that.

News of this Destiny 2 update delay comes as the release date for extraction shooter Marathon rapidly approaches. Bungie hasn't named the game as a reason for its Destiny 2 plans changing, but given past delays and controversies, Marathon is likely to require a lot of Bungie's attention at launch.

Destiny 2's Shadow and Order update, or whatever the studio changes its name to, will be arriving on June 9th. You can check the game out for free right now on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox.
